page.title: 01Environment
page.content: The land outside Carrowdore is mainly arable land with farms everywhere and maybe a few houses on their own. The farmers use the land for wheat, barley silage and grazing land. The village itself consists of private housing and Council owned properties. Every house has a garden and there are no flats in Carrowdore. The village has a very wide Main Street, a supermarket, a Post Office, a garage, two small shops a playing area and a Primary School. Just outside the village is the Castle which is completely surrounded by a forest. In September the village hosts a Motorbike Race called the Carrowdore 100.
